description: I don?t remember what prompted me to explore this valley for a waterfall.  I had a point in my gps and enough time to get there and come back.  The start was not fun as I tried to go over to a small valley to get down to the main brook.  The area had been logged and brush was prickly and waist high.  Eventually I found the small valley and followed a small brook.  It has a quasi fall covered by green moss.  Once on Harris Brook, I followed it downstream and to my surprise, I found a very nice three tier fall in a small gorge.  The lowest fall is the highest and there is a very nice pool above it.  If you bring some rope you should be able to downclimb and swim in it?your private pool in the wilderness!  Falls are at  N46.15137° W60.85211°.  To get back to my car, I followed another small brook uphill.Stats for the hike; 2.9km, 1hr, 1180ft total elevation
directions: Cabot Trail from Baddeck to Middle River.  On top of Hunters Mountain.  Turn on Crowdis Mountain Rd and drive about 4.2 km and park N46.15846° W60.85885°.
title: Harris Brook Fall
